title: irfan_pak10
author: irfan_pak10
content: Bountyportals is thrilled to announce the launch of our latest feature: Bulk Sender ! With this new feature, our users, clients, and bounty managers can easily send bulk transactions of Erc20, BSC, and Matic chain tokens.Sending tokens in bulk has never been easier or more efficient. With Bountyportals' Bulk Sender, you can quickly and securely send hundreds or even thousands of tokens to multiple addresses in just a few clicks. Whether you're managing a bounty campaign or sending rewards to multiple participants, our Bulk Sender simplifies the process and saves you time.Our Bulk Sender is available to all Bountyportals users, and it supports a wide range of tokens on the Erc20, BSC, and Matic chains. We're continuously expanding our supported tokens to provide our users with even more options.At Bountyportals, we're dedicated to providing our users with the best tools and features to streamline their token management tasks. Our Bulk Sender is just one of the many ways we're helping our users achieve their goals.If you're interested in learning more about our Bulk Sender or want to try it out for yourself, head over to our platform and give it a try. We'd love to hear your feedback and suggestions on how we can continue to improve our platform to better serve your needs.Here is our BulkSender website: https://bulksender.bountyportals.com/Telegram: https://t.me/OfficialbountyportalUsers can refer others to Bountyportals and earn a 10% fee of whatever we make from transactions made by their referred users. To participate, simply ping us once you've recommended someone, and we'll handle the rest.

comments.body: Apart from safety, people also take into account transaction fees and how the transaction process works. Are you taking into consideration whether the transaction fee is more affordable compared to other channels?

I tried the BSC test net and sent some amounts of BNB to many wallets, the process was smooth, and they cut a few fees.For how the transaction process works:After that, you will find that the transaction has been completed, and the batch hash has appeared.Really a great tool. Thanks, @irfan_pak10. I will always use it, and it will be a really useful tool for bounty managers for those who find it challenging to distribute coins to thousands of wallet addresses of participants with reasonable fees; I hope this tool will support more networks in the future.

comments.body: Looks interesting, thank you for letting me know @irfan_pak10, of course I will be happy to test it out and share my review, just need to find some precious time that I always have not enough of ERC20 this is very interesting and if indeed cheap then maybe it could be useful in some cases.how much that cost, how many transactions can I send, how safe this is? editI have edited my last question after some reading, here is itis this an routing tool? how with contract permissions, are there any needed, if yes how high are amounts setup, is it max or current transaction amount, do i send my cons first to some Bountyportals contract or this routing tool and sends directly (much safer option)

comments.author: irfan_pak10
comments.body: Quote from: wwzsocki on May 05, 2023, 08:58:42 PMLooks interesting, thank you for letting me know @irfan_pak10, of course I will be happy to test it out and share my review, just need to find some precious time that I always have not enough of ERC20 this is very interesting and if indeed cheap then maybe it could be useful in some cases.how much that cost, how many transactions can I send, how safe this is. is this some tools or i have to deposit to Boun typortals first? Thank you for your kind words. I would greatly appreciate it if you could test out this dApp. I am also happy to hear if your client uses our website. Unfortunately, ERC20 gas fees cannot be reduced through bulk sending, but I can ask my development team to add a feature to the UI that indicates the best time to use ERC20 bulk sending. In addition to the gas fees, we charge a small fee of $0.03 per wallet.There is no limit to the number of transactions you can make, and we automatically process batches of 200 addresses. We have taken great care to ensure that our system is secure and safe, but we recommend starting with a smaller number of addresses, such as 10-20, and gradually increasing the number as you become more comfortable with the process. I will need to confirm your last question with my development team.Thank you.

comments.author: julerz12
comments.body: Hey Irfan, thanks for the dm and for informing me about this tool.While I appreciate the information, I am very wary of connecting any of my hot wallets to any unknown website/platform.Also, just a couple of inquiries.1. Could you share with us the contract address for the smart contract your platform is using? Making it public so that everyone can see and check it before connecting to your platform would give us users fewer worries.2. Did you guys build this from the ground up or was it forked from a similar open-source tool like Disperse?3. How much are the fees when using this tool? I've seen plenty of similar platforms that require a hefty amount of service fee when using their dApp which is pretty annoying.Lastly, could you guys also deploy it on Avalanche, Arbitrum, and Fantom? That would be nice.
